poem:
In The Light Of Vocal Thunder

From throb of steel, birthed in the Midland's mire,
Resounds a voice - half falsetto fire,
Half burly thunder, slicing ether fine.
Halford, of Judas Priest, gods intertwine
In thee; Invincible, in song you wield,
This musical chameleon, his vocal shield.
To question him is to crack open dawn,
Into the heart where heavy metal's born.
